delete.description: Deletes a role instance from a cloud service.

get.description: Gets a role instance from a cloud service.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: The expand expression to apply to the operation.

get.description: Retrieves information about the run-time state of a role instance in a cloud service.
Gets the list of all role instances in a cloud service. Use nextLink property in the response to get the next page of role instances. Do this till nextLink is null to fetch all the role instances.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: The expand expression to apply to the operation.

post.description: The Reboot Role Instance asynchronous operation requests a reboot of a role instance in the cloud service.
The Reimage Role Instance asynchronous operation reinstalls the operating system on instances of web roles or worker roles.

The Rebuild Role Instance asynchronous operation reinstalls the operating system on instances of web roles or worker roles and initializes the storage resources that are used by them. If you do not want to initialize storage resources, you can use Reimage Role Instance.

get.description: Gets a remote desktop file for a role instance in a cloud service.
Gets a role from a cloud service.
Gets a list of all roles in a cloud service. Use nextLink property in the response to get the next page of roles. Do this till nextLink is null to fetch all the roles.

put.description: Create or update a cloud service. Please note some properties can be set only during cloud service creation.

get.description: Display information about a cloud service.
Gets the status of a cloud service.

Gets a list of all cloud services in the subscription, regardless of the associated resource group. Use nextLink property in the response to get the next page of Cloud Services. Do this till nextLink is null to fetch all the Cloud Services.
Gets a list of all cloud services under a resource group. Use nextLink property in the response to get the next page of Cloud Services. Do this till nextLink is null to fetch all the Cloud Services.

post.description: Power off the cloud service. Note that resources are still attached and you are getting charged for the resources.
Restarts one or more role instances in a cloud service.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: List of cloud service role instance names.

post.description: Reimage asynchronous operation reinstalls the operating system on instances of web roles or worker roles.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: List of cloud service role instance names.

post.description: Rebuild Role Instances reinstalls the operating system on instances of web roles or worker roles and initializes the storage resources that are used by them. If you do not want to initialize storage resources, you can use Reimage Role Instances.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: List of cloud service role instance names.

post.description: Deletes role instances in a cloud service.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: List of cloud service role instance names.

put.description: Updates the role instances in the specified update domain.

parameters.name: updateDomain
parameters.description: Specifies an integer value that identifies the update domain. Update domains are identified with a zero-based index: the first update domain has an ID of 0, the second has an ID of 1, and so on.

get.description: Gets the specified update domain of a cloud service. Use nextLink property in the response to get the next page of update domains. Do this till nextLink is null to fetch all the update domains.

parameters.name: updateDomain
parameters.description: Specifies an integer value that identifies the update domain. Update domains are identified with a zero-based index: the first update domain has an ID of 0, the second has an ID of 1, and so on.

get.description: Gets a list of all update domains in a cloud service.

target.description: The target of the particular error.

errordetail.description: The internal error message or exception dump.

target.description: The target of the particular error.

CloudError.description: An error response from the Compute service.

tier.description: The tier of the cloud service role instance.

RoleInstanceNetworkProfile.description: Describes the network profile for the role instance.

networkInterfaces.description: Specifies the list of resource Ids for the network interfaces associated with the role instance.

displayStatus.description: The short localizable label for the status.

message.description: The detailed status message, including for alerts and error messages.

RoleInstanceInstanceView.description: The instance view of the role instance.

CloudServiceRoleSku.description: Describes the cloud service role sku.

name.description: The sku name. NOTE: If the new SKU is not supported on the hardware the cloud service is currently on, you need to delete and recreate the cloud service or move back to the old sku.

tier.description:
Specifies the tier of the cloud service. Possible Values are

**Standard**

**Basic**

capacity.description: Specifies the number of role instances in the cloud service.

uniqueId.description: Specifies the ID which uniquely identifies a cloud service role.

CloudServiceRole.description: Describes a role of the cloud service.

CloudServiceUpgradeMode.description:
Update mode for the cloud service. Role instances are allocated to update domains when the service is deployed. Updates can be initiated manually in each update domain or initiated automatically in all update domains. Possible Values are

**Auto**

**Manual**

**Simultaneous**

If not specified, the default value is Auto. If set to Manual, PUT UpdateDomain must be called to apply the update. If set to Auto, the update is automatically applied to each update domain in sequence.

CloudServiceRoleProfile.description: Describes the role profile for the cloud service.

roles.description: List of roles for the cloud service.

CloudServiceVaultCertificate.description: Describes a single certificate reference in a Key Vault, and where the certificate should reside on the role instance.

certificateUrl.description: This is the URL of a certificate that has been uploaded to Key Vault as a secret.

CloudServiceVaultSecretGroup.description: Describes a set of certificates which are all in the same Key Vault.

sourceVault.description: The relative URL of the Key Vault containing all of the certificates in VaultCertificates.

vaultCertificates.description: The list of key vault references in SourceVault which contain certificates.

CloudServiceOsProfile.description: Describes the OS profile for the cloud service.

secrets.description: Specifies set of certificates that should be installed onto the role instances.

LoadBalancerFrontendIPConfigurationPrope.description: Describes a cloud service IP Configuration

privateIPAddress.description: The private IP address referenced by the cloud service.

CloudServiceNetworkProfile.description: Network Profile for the cloud service.

loadBalancerConfigurations.description: The list of load balancer configurations for the cloud service.

publisher.description: The name of the extension handler publisher.

type.description: Specifies the type of the extension.

typeHandlerVersion.description: Specifies the version of the extension. Specifies the version of the extension. If this element is not specified or an asterisk (*) is used as the value, the latest version of the extension is used. If the value is specified with a major version number and an asterisk as the minor version number (X.), the latest minor version of the specified major version is selected. If a major version number and a minor version number are specified (X.Y), the specific extension version is selected. If a version is specified, an auto-upgrade is performed on the role instance.

autoUpgradeMinorVersion.description: Explicitly specify whether platform can automatically upgrade typeHandlerVersion to higher minor versions when they become available.

settings.description: Public settings for the extension. For JSON extensions, this is the JSON settings for the extension. For XML Extension (like RDP), this is the XML setting for the extension.

protectedSettings.description: Protected settings for the extension which are encrypted before sent to the role instance.

forceUpdateTag.description:
Tag to force apply the provided public and protected settings.
Changing the tag value allows for re-running the extension without changing any of the public or protected settings.
If forceUpdateTag is not changed, updates to public or protected settings would still be applied by the handler.
If neither forceUpdateTag nor any of public or protected settings change, extension would flow to the role instance with the same sequence-number, and
it is up to handler implementation whether to re-run it or not

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state, which only appears in the response.

rolesAppliedTo.description: Optional list of roles to apply this extension. If property is not specified or '*' is specified, extension is applied to all roles in the cloud service.

CloudServiceExtensionProfile.description: Describes a cloud service extension profile.

extensions.description: List of extensions for the cloud service.

packageUrl.description: Specifies a URL that refers to the location of the service package in the Blob service. The service package URL can be Shared Access Signature (SAS) URI from any storage account.

configuration.description: Specifies the XML service configuration (.cscfg) for the cloud service.

configurationUrl.description: Specifies a URL that refers to the location of the service configuration in the Blob service. The service package URL  can be Shared Access Signature (SAS) URI from any storage account.

startCloudService.description:
(Optional) Indicates whether to start the cloud service immediately after it is created. The default value is `true`.
If false, the service model is still deployed, but the code is not run immediately. Instead, the service is PoweredOff until you call Start, at which time the service will be started. A deployed service still incurs charges, even if it is poweredoff.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state, which only appears in the response.

uniqueId.description: The unique identifier for the cloud service.

count.description: Number of instances having this status code

CloudServiceInstanceView.description: InstanceView of CloudService as a whole

RoleInstances.description: Specifies a list of role instances from the cloud service.

roleInstances.description: List of cloud service role instance names. Value of '*' will signify all role instances of the cloud service.

UpdateDomain.description: Defines an update domain for the cloud service.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
